alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Portage, northern Waupaca and northwestern Outagamie Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Amherst, or 14 miles east of Stevens Point, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Portage, northern Waupaca and northwestern Outagamie Counties, including the following locations... Fitzgerald Corners, Buckbee, Schmidt Corner, Sugar Bush, Rosholt, Scandinavia, Adams Beach, Northland, Nelsonville and Ogdensburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
